1.text: Good a dry morsel and peace with it, above a house full of sacrifices of contention.

2.text: An understanding servant shall rule a son causing shame, and shall divide the inheritance in the midst of the brethren.

3.text: The crucible for silver and the furnace for gold: and Jehovah tries hearts.

4.text: He doing evil attends upon, lips of vanity; he lying feeds upon a tongue of mischief.

5.text: He mocking to the poor one reproached him making him: and he rejoicing at misfortune shall not be unpunished.

6.text: The crown of old men, sonsâ€™ sons: and the glory of sons their fathers.

7.text: The lip of excellence is not becoming to, the foolish one: much less the lip of falsehood to the noble one.

8.text: The gift a stone of grace in the, eyes of him possessing it: to all which it shall turn it shall prosper.

9.text: He covering transgression seeks love; and he perverting in the word, separates a, friend.

10.text: A reproof will take hold upon, him understanding more than a hundred, blows the foolish.

11.text: An evil one will seek only contradiction: and a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

12.text: A bereaved bear meeting with a, man, and not a fool in his folly.

13.text: He turning back evil, instead of good, evil shall not move from his house.

14.text: The causing water to break forth is the beginning of strife: cast off contention before being irritated.

15.text: He justifying the unjust one and he condemning the just one, is an abomination to Jehovah, also they two.

16.text: Wherefore this a price in the hand of the foolish one to obtain wisdom, and no heart?

17.text: A friend loves in all time, and a brother shall be born for straits.

18.text: A man wanting heart will strike the hand, pledging a pledge before his friend.

19.text: He loving transgression loves contention: he lifting up his gate seeks breaking.

20.text: The perverse of heart shall not find good: and he turning about with his tongue shall fall into evil.

21.text: The foolish one was born for sorrow to himself, and the father of the foolish one shall not rejoice.

22.text: A joyful heart shall make good healing: and a dejected spirit shall dry up the bones.

23.text: The unjust one will take a gift from the bosom to turn, aside the paths of judgment.

24.text: Wisdom, is with the face of him understanding, and the eyes of the foolish one are in the ends of the earth.

25.text: A foolish son a grief to his father, and bitterness to her bringing him forth.

26.text: Also punishing to the just one is not good, to strike nobles for uprightness.

27.text: He withholding his words will shew knowledge: I man of understanding is a cool spirit.

28.text: Also the foolish one being silent shall be thought wise: and he shutting his lips, understanding.
